name: StackEdit Unretardifier
description: Styles to make StackEdit more visually pleasing.
additional_info:
Version 1.0

There is an ethos among modern site design that implies all text must be super-sized and all DOM elements must be max-spaced out in order to generate an illusion of simplicity to appease a mysterious demographic that is overwhelmed by anything more visually complex than a toaster.

If you write markdown with StackEdit you're probably not in that camp.

This was inspired by my dissatisfaction with StackEdit's preview rendering of tables, which IMHO goes overboard with padding, and uses a tic-tac-toe style border scheme. The ability, in-app, to adjust preview styles has apparently been removed. In fixing that (to my taste), I tweaked a few other things. This style set is a bit of 'odds n sods'. Some you might like, others not. But I think in general, it provides a more readable and efficient preview experience.

See comments in the code for the exact changes.
